title: Monarchy of Canada
summary: The monarchy of Canada is at the core of Canada's constitutional federal structure and Westminster-style parliamentary democracy.[6] The monarchy is the foundation of the executive (Queen-in-Council), legislative (Queen-in-Parliament), and judicial (Queen-on-the-Bench) branches of both federal and provincial jurisdictions.[10] The Queen of Canada (and head of state) has been Elizabeth II since 6 February 1952.[11][12][17]
